The provisions of paragraphs 2 to 4 of Article 843 and from Article 844 to 847 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to a curator .

For acts where there is a conflict of interest between the curator or his/her representative and a person under curatorship , the curator shall apply to the family court for the appointment of a temporary curator ; provided that this shall not apply in the case where there is a supervisor of a curator .
The family court may appoint a supervisor of a curator , if it finds this necessary , at the request of a person under curatorship or his/her relative , or a curator , or ex officio .

The provisions of Article 644 , Article 654 , Article 655 , paragraph -LRB- 4 -RRB- of Article 843 , Article 844 , Article 846 , Article 847 , Article 850 , Article 851 , Article 859-2 , Article 859-3 , paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 861 , and Article 862 shall apply mutatis mutandis to a supervisor of a curator .

In this case , the term ` represent the ward regarding ' in item -LRB- iv -RRB- of Article 851 shall be deemed to be replaced with ` represent a person under curatorship regarding , or give consent for a person under curatorship to undertake the same ' .

At the request of a person prescribed by the main clause of Article 11 or a curator , or a supervisor of a curator , the family court may make an order that grants power of representation to the curator , concerning specified juristic acts for the person under curatorship .
An order referred to in the preceding paragraph made at the request of any person other than the person under curatorship shall require the consent of the person under curatorship .
The family court may rescind an order referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- , in whole or in part , at the request of a person prescribed by that paragraph .

description: (Order Granting Power of Representation to Curator)

sentences.text: A curator , in undertaking the affairs of curatorship , shall respect the intention of the person under curatorship , and consider his/her mental and physical condition and living circumstances .

The provisions of Article 644 , Article 859-2 , Article 859-3 , paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 861 , Article 862 , and Article 863 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the affairs of curatorship , and the provision of the proviso to Article 824 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where a curator represents a person under curatorship based upon an order granting the power of representation referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the preceding Article .

The provisions of Article 654 , Article 655 , Article 870 , Article 871 and Article 873 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case of termination of office of a curator , and the provisions of Article 832 shall apply mutatis mutandis to claims that arise from curatorship between a curator , or a supervisor of a curator , and a person under curatorship .
reverb: the case of termination of office of a curator

description: (Affairs of Curatorship and Termination of Office of Curator)

sentences.text: Assistance shall commence by order of commencement of assistance .
-LRB- Appointment etc. of Assistant or Temporary Assistant -RRB-
If the family court orders commencement of assistance , it will appoint an assistant ex officio .
The provisions of paragraphs -LRB- 2 -RRB- to -LRB- 4 -RRB- of Article 843 and from Article 844 to 847 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to an assistant .

For acts where there is a conflict of interest between the assistant or his/her representative and a person under assistance , the assistant shall apply to the family court for the appointment of a temporary assistant ; provided that this shall not apply in the case where there is a supervisor of an assistant .
The family court may appoint a supervisor of an assistant , if it finds this necessary , at the request of a person under assistance , his/her relative , or an assistant , or ex officio .

The provisions of Article 644 , Article 654 , Article 655 , paragraph -LRB- 4 -RRB- of Article 843 , Article 844 , Article 846 , Article 847 , Article 850 , Article 851 , Article 859-2 , Article 859-3 , paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 861 , and Article 862 shall apply mutatis mutandis to a supervisor of an assistant .

In this case , the term ` represent the ward regarding ' in item -LRB- iv -RRB- of Article 851 shall be deemed to be replaced with ` represent a person under assistance regarding , or give consent for a person under assistance to undertake the same .

At the request of a person prescribed by the main clause of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 15 , an assistant , or a supervisor of an assistant , the family court may make an order that grants power of representation to the assistant , concerning specified juristic acts for the person under assistance .
The provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- and paragraph -LRB- 3 -RRB- of Article 876-4 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the order referred to in the preceding paragraph .

description: (Order Granting Power of Representation to Assistant)

sentences.text: The provisions of Article 644 , Article 859-2 , Article 859-3 , paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 861 , Article 862 , Article 863 , and paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 876-5 , shall apply mutatis mutandis to the affairs of assistance , and the provision of the proviso to Article 824 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where an assistant represents a person under assistance based upon an order granting the power of representation referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the preceding Article .

The provisions of Article 654 , Article 655 , Article 870 , Article 871 and Article 873 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case of termination of office of an assistant , and the provisions of Article 832 shall apply mutatis mutandis to claims that arise from assistance between an assistant , or a supervisor of an assistant , and a person under assistance
reverb: the case of termination of office of an assistant

description: (Affairs of Assistance and Termination of Office of Assistant)

sentences.text: Lineal relative by blood and siblings have a duty to support each other .
If special circumstances exist , the family court may also impose a duty of support between relatives within the third degree , in addition to the case prescribed in the preceding paragraph .
reverb: may also impose a duty of

sentences.text: If an alteration in circumstances arises after an order pursuant to the provision of the preceding paragraph , the family court may revoke that order .

In the case where there exist several persons under a duty to give support , and agreement has not , or can not be , reached between the parties with respect to the order in which they are to give support , the family court shall determine the order .
In the case where there exist several persons entitled to support and the financial capacity of the person under a duty to give support is insufficient to support them all , the same shall apply .

If agreement has not , or can not be , reached between the parties with respect to the extent and form of support , the family court shall determine such matters , considering the needs of the person entitled to support , the financial capacity of the person under a duty to give support , and any other related circumstances .

If an alteration in circumstances arises after an agreement or an order regarding the order of persons under a duty to support , persons entitled to support , or the extent or form of support , the family court may alter or revoke the agreement or the order .

description: (Alteration or Revocation of Agreement or Order with Regard to Support)

sentences.text: The right to support may not be subject to disposition .

description: (Prohibition of Disposition of Claim for Support)

sentences.text: Inheritance shall commence upon the death of the decedent .
Inheritance shall commence at the place of domicile of the decedent .
reverb: the place of domicile of the decedent

sentences.text: If the right to claim for recovery of inheritance is not exercised within five years of the time an heir or his/her legal representative becomes aware of the fact that the inheritance right has been infringed , that right shall be extinguished by prescription .
The right shall also be extinguished if twenty years have passed from the time of commencement of inheritance .
reverb: the time of commencement of inheritance

description: (Right to Claim for Recovery of Inheritance)

sentences.text: Expenses relating to inherited property shall be paid out of that property ; provided that this shall not apply to expenses resulting from the negligence of an heir .
The expenses of the preceding paragraph are not required to be paid out of property obtained by a claimant to statutory reserved portion through abatement of a gift .
In regard to inheritance , an unborn child shall be deemed to have already been born .
The provision of the preceding paragraph shall not apply if the child is stillborn .
-LRB- Right to Inheritance of Child and Heir per Stirpes , etc. . -RRB-

description: (Unborn Child's Legal Capacity to Hold Rights Relating to Inheritance)

sentences.text: The child of a decedent shall be an heir .

If a decedent 's child has died before the commencement of inheritance , or has lost the right to inheritance by application of the provisions of Article 891 or disinheritance , the child of the decedent 's child shall be an heir as an heir per stirpes ; provided that this shall not apply if the child is not a lineal descendant of the decedent .
reverb: the child of the decedent 's child
is not a lineal descendant of

sentences.text: The provision of the preceding paragraph shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where an heir per stirpes has died before the commencement of inheritance , or has lost the right of inheritance as an heir per stirpes by application of the provisions of Article 891 , or by disinheritance .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: In the case where there is no person to become an heir pursuant to the provisions of Article 887 , the following persons shall become heirs in accordance with the following order of rank : -LRB- i -RRB- lineal ascendants of the decedent ; provided that between persons of differing degree of kinship , the person who is of closer relationship shall have higher priority of inheritance ; -LRB- ii -RRB- siblings of the decedent .
The provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 887 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in item -LRB- ii -RRB- of the preceding paragraph .

description: (Right of Inheritance of Lineal Ascendant and Sibling)

sentences.text: The spouse of a decedent shall always be an heir .
In this case , if there is a person to become an heir pursuant to the provisions of Article 887 or the preceding Article , the spouse shall be of the same rank as that person .

The following persons may not become an heir : -LRB- i -RRB- a person who has received punishment for intentionally causing , or attempting to cause , the death of a decedent or a person of equal or prior rank in relation to inheritance ; -LRB- ii -RRB- a person who is aware that the decedent was killed by someone but made no accusation or complaint about this ; provided that this shall not apply if that person can not discern right from wrong , or if the killer was that person 's spouse or lineal relative ; -LRB- iii -RRB- a person who prevented a decedent from making , revoking , rescinding , or changing a will relating to inheritance through fraud or duress ; -LRB- iv -RRB- a person who forced a decedent to make , revoke , rescind , or change a will relating to inheritance through fraud or duress ; or -LRB- v -RRB- a person who has forged , altered , destroyed , or concealed a decedent 's will relating to inheritance .
reverb: that person 's spouse or lineal relative

sentences.text: A decedent may make an application to the family court for the disinheritance of a presumed heir -LRB- here and below , referring to a person who would otherwise become an heir upon the commencement of inheritance -RRB- who has a legally reserved portion if that person has abused or given grave insult to the decedent , or if there has been any other grave misconduct on the part of the presumed heir .

If a decedent has indicated an intention by will to disinherit a presumed heir , the executor of that will shall apply to the family court for disinheritance of the presumed heir without delay after the will has taken effect .
In this case , the disinheritance of that presumed heir shall have retroactive effect from the time of the decedent 's death .
reverb: the disinheritance of that presumed heir
the time of the decedent 's death

sentences.text: A decedent may at any time make an application to the family court to rescind the disinheritance of a presumed heir .
The provision of the preceding Article shall apply mutatis mutandis to the rescission of disinheritance of a presumed heir .
reverb: The provision of the preceding Article
the rescission of disinheritance of a presumed heir

sentences.text: If inheritance has commenced before a ruling has become final and binding after an application for the disinheritance of a presumed heir , or the rescission of that disinheritance , the family court may order any necessary disposition with regard to the administration of inherited property at the request of a relative , an interested party , or a public prosecutor .
The same shall apply in the case where a will was made for the disinheritance of a presumed heir .
reverb: the disinheritance of a presumed heir

sentences.text: The provisions of Articles 27 to 29 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where the family court has appointed an administrator of inherited property pursuant to the provisions of the preceding paragraph .
reverb: an administrator of inherited property pursuant

description: (Administration of Inherited Property before Ruling for Disinheritance of Presumed Heir Becomes Unappealable)

sentences.text: From the time of commencement of inheritance , an heir shall succeed blanket rights and duties attached to the property of the decedent ; provided that this shall not apply to rights or duties of the decedent that are purely personal .

Despite the provision of the preceding Article , rights to ownership of a genealogy , equipment used in rituals , and any grave , shall be succeeded by the person who custom dictates shall preside over rituals for ancestors ; provided that if the decedent designates a person who shall preside over rituals for ancestors , this person shall succeed rights to ownership .
If , in the case referred to in the main text of the preceding paragraph , the custom is not evident , the family court shall determine who shall succeed the rights in that paragraph .
reverb: the main text of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: If there are two or more heirs , the inherited property shall belong to those heirs in co-ownership .
Each joint heir shall succeed the rights and duties of the decedent according to his/her share in inheritance .
reverb: the rights and duties of the decedent

sentences.text: If there are two or more heirs of the same rank , their shares in inheritance shall be determined by the following items : -LRB- i -RRB- if a child and a spouse are heirs , the child 's share in inheritance and the spouse 's share in inheritance shall be one half each ; -LRB- ii -RRB- if a spouse and lineal ascendant are heirs , the spouse 's share in inheritance shall be two thirds , and the lineal ascendant 's share in inheritance shall be one third ; -LRB- iii -RRB- if a spouse and sibling -LRB- s -RRB- are heirs , the spouse 's share in inheritance shall be three quarters , and the sibling 's share in inheritance shall be one quarter ; -LRB- iv -RRB- if there are two or more children , lineal ascendants , or siblings , the share in the inheritance of each shall be divided equally ; provided that the share in inheritance of a sibling who shares only one parent with the decedent shall be one half of the share in inheritance of a sibling who shares both parents .

The share in inheritance of a lineal descendant who becomes an heir pursuant to the provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- or paragraph -LRB- 3 -RRB- of Article 887 shall be the same as the share that person 's lineal ascendant would have received ; provided that if there are two or more lineal descendants , their shares in inheritance shall be determined in accordance with the provisions of the preceding Article .
The provision of the preceding paragraph shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where a child of a sibling becomes an heir pursuant to the provision of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 889 .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph

description: (Statutory Share in Inheritance of Heirs per Stirpes)

sentences.text: Despite the provisions of the preceding two Articles , a decedent may by will determine the share in inheritance of joint heirs , or entrust a third party to determine the share ; provided that a decedent or a third party may not violate provisions relating to legally reserved portion .

If a decedent determines , or has a third party determine , the share in inheritance of a single heir or several heirs amongst joint heirs , the share in inheritance of the other joint heir -LRB- s -RRB- shall be determined pursuant to the provisions of the preceding two Articles .
reverb: the provisions of the preceding two Articles

description: (Designation of Share in Inheritance by Will)

sentences.text: If there is a person from amongst joint heirs who has previously received a testamentary gift , or has received a gift for marriage , adoption , or as capital for livelihood , the total inherited property shall be deemed the value calculated by adding the value of the gift to the value of the property belonging to the decedent at the time of commencement of inheritance and the share in inheritance of that person shall be the remaining amount after deducting the value of that testamentary gift or a gift from the share in inheritance calculated pursuant to the provisions of the preceding three Articles .
If the value of the testamentary gift or gift is equal to , or exceeds , the value of a donee or recipient 's share in inheritance , he/she may not receive the share in inheritance .
reverb: may not receive the share in

sentences.text: If the decedent indicates an intention contrary to the provisions of the preceding two paragraphs , that intention shall only have effect to the extent that it does not violate the provisions relating to legally reserved portion .

description: (Share in Inheritance of Heir who has Received Special Benefit)

sentences.text: With regard to the value of the gift referred to in the provisions of the preceding Article , even if , through the conduct of the recipient there the property of the gift is lost , or if there is a fluctuation in its value , the determination of value shall be deemed as the value at the time of commencement of inheritance in its original state .
reverb: the provisions of the preceding Article

sentences.text: If there is a person from amongst joint heirs who has made a special contribution to the maintenance or increase of the decedent 's property through the provision of labor or in the form of property relating to the decedent 's business , medical treatment or nursing of the decedent , or other means , the total inherited property shall be deemed the value calculated by deducting the contributory portion as determined by agreement by the joint heirs from the value of the property of the decedent at the time of commencement of inheritance , and that person 's share in inheritance shall be the amount of the contribution added to the share in inheritance calculated pursuant to the provisions of Articles 900 to 902 inclusive .
reverb: has made a special contribution to
the maintenance or increase of the decedent 's property

sentences.text: If the agreement of the preceding paragraph is not , or can not be , settled , the family court shall determine the amount of contributory portion at the request of the person who has contributed referred to in the provision of the preceding paragraph , considering the period of contribution , the means and extent of contribution , the amount of the inherited property , and all other circumstances .

The contributory portion may not exceed the amount calculated by deducting the value of a testamentary gift from the value of the property belonging to the decedent at the time of commencement of inheritance .

The application referred to in paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- may be made in the case where there has been an application pursuant to the provision of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 907 , or in the case where there has been an application pursuant to the provision of Article 910 .

If one joint heir assigns his/her share of inheritance to a third party before a division of the inherited property , any other joint heir may obtain the share through the reimbursement of the value and expenses of that and recover the share in inheritance .
The right of the preceding paragraph shall be exercised within one month .
reverb: The right of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: Upon the division of inherited property , the type and nature of goods or rights belonging to the inherited property , the age , occupation , mental and physical state , and financial circumstances of each heir , and all other matters , shall be considered .
-LRB- Agreement or Ruling for Division of Inherited Property etc. . -RRB-
Joint heirs may at any time divide inherited property by agreement except in the case where this is prohibited by the decedent 's will pursuant to the provision of the following Article .
reverb: the provision of the following Article

sentences.text: If agreement is not , or can not be , settled between joint heirs regarding division of inherited property , each of the joint heirs may make an application to the family court for a division of the inherited property .
In the case referred to in the preceding paragraph , if there is a special reason , the family court may prohibit the division of the inherited property , in whole or part , for a specified period .
reverb: the division of the inherited property

sentences.text: A decedent may by will determine the form of division of inherited property , or entrust this to a third party , or prohibit division for a period not exceeding five years from the time of commencement of inheritance .
reverb: may by will determine the form of
the form of division of inherited property

description: (Designation of Form of Division of Inherited Property and Prohibition of Division)

sentences.text: Division of inherited property shall have retroactive effect from the time of the commencement of inheritance ; provided that this shall not prejudice the rights of a third party .
reverb: the time of the commencement of inheritance
shall not prejudice the rights of

sentences.text: In the case where a person who becomes an heir through affiliation after the commencement of inheritance intends to apply for a division of the inherited property , if other heirs have already divided the inherited property or made another disposition , he/she shall only have a claim of payment for value .
reverb: a division of the inherited property
shall only have a claim of

description: (Claim of Payment for Value of Person Affiliated after Commencement of Inheritance)

sentences.text: Each joint heir shall , according to his/her share in inheritance , bear liability to guarantee any other joint heir , just as a seller .

Each joint heir shall guarantee , according to his/her share in inheritance , the solvency of any obligor of the inherited property at the time of division regarding claims arising from the division of inherited property .
Each joint heir shall guarantee the solvency of any obligor of the inherited property at the time for performance regarding a claim that is either not yet due or has a condition precedent .
reverb: the solvency of any obligor of the inherited property

description: (Liability to Guarantee Claim Arising from Division of Inherited Property)

sentences.text: If there is an insolvent joint heir who is liable to guarantee other joint heirs , the portion of the liability which the insolvent joint heir is to bear shall be apportioned amongst other joint heirs with a right to reimbursement , and other solvent joint heirs shall contribute to the portion unable to be reimbursed according to the share in inheritance of each ; provided that if there is negligence on the part of the person who seeks reimbursement , he/she may not make a claim against other another joint heir to contribute .
reverb: may not make a claim against

description: (Share of Liability to Guarantee Insolvent Joint Heir)

sentences.text: If a decedent has expressed a different intent by will , the provisions of the preceding three Articles shall not apply .

description: (Determination of Liability to Guarantee by Will)

sentences.text: An heir shall give unconditional or qualified acceptance , or renunciation , regarding inheritance within three months of the time he/she has knowledge that there has been a commencement of inheritance for him/her ; provided that this period may be extended by the family court at the request of an interested party or a public prosecutor .
An heir may investigate inherited property before making an acceptance or renunciation of inheritance .

description: (Period for Acceptance or Renunciation of Inheritance)

sentences.text: If an heir dies without having made acceptance or renunciation of inheritance , the period of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the preceding Article shall be calculated from the time that person 's heir comes to know of the commencement of inheritance for himself/herself .

If an heir is a minor or an adult ward , the period in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 915 shall be calculated from the time that legal representative comes to know of the commencement of inheritance for the minor or adult ward .

An heir shall administer inherited property with the same care he/she would exercise over his/her own property ; provided that this shall not apply if he/she has accepted or renounced the inheritance .
The family court may at any time order any necessary disposition for the preservation of inherited property at the request of an interested party or a public prosecutor .

The provisions of Articles 27 to 29 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where the family court has appointed an administrator manager of inherited property pursuant to the provision of the preceding paragraph .
reverb: an administrator manager of inherited property pursuant

sentences.text: Acceptance or renunciation of inheritance may not be revoked even within the period referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 915 .

The provision of the preceding paragraph shall not prevent the rescission of acceptance or renunciation of inheritance made pursuant to the provisions of Part 1 -LRB- General Provisions -RRB- and Part 4 -LRB- Relatives -RRB- .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph
the rescission of acceptance or renunciation of inheritance
the rescission of acceptance or renunciation of inheritance

sentences.text: The right of rescission in the preceding paragraph shall be extinguished by prescription if not exercised within six months of the time ratification becomes possible .
The right of rescission in the preceding paragraph shall be extinguished if ten years have passed since the time of acceptance or renunciation of inheritance .
reverb: the time of acceptance or renunciation of inheritance

sentences.text: A person who intends to rescind qualified acceptance or renunciation of inheritance pursuant to the provision of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- shall provide a statement to that effect to the family court .

description: (Revocation and Rescission of Acceptance and Renunciation of Inheritance)

sentences.text: If an heir makes unconditional acceptance , he/she shall inherit the rights and duties of the decedent without limitation .
reverb: the rights and duties of the decedent

sentences.text: An heir shall be deemed to have made unconditional acceptance in the following cases : -LRB- i -RRB- if an heir has made a disposition of the inherited property in whole or in part ; provided that this shall not apply to an act of preservation or a lease that does not exceed the period determined in Article 602 ; -LRB- ii -RRB- if an heir has not made qualified acceptance or renunciation of inheritance within the period of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 915 ; -LRB- iii -RRB- if an heir , even after having made qualified acceptance or renunciation of inheritance , conceals inherited property in whole or part , uses that property for him/herself , or failed intentionally to enter it in the inventory of inherited property ; provided that this shall not apply after the acceptance of a person who has become an heir due to the renunciation of inheritance of the original heir .
reverb: shall be deemed to have made
qualified acceptance or renunciation of inheritance
has become an heir due to
the renunciation of inheritance of the original heir

sentences.text: An heir may accept inheritance reserving to perform the obligation or testamentary gift of the decedent only within the extent of the property obtained by inheritance .
If there are two or more heirs , qualified acceptance may only be made if all members of the joint heirs make qualified acceptance jointly .
reverb: all members of the joint heirs

sentences.text: If an heir intends to make qualified acceptance , he/she shall prepare an inventory of the inherited property and submit this to the family court with a statement to that effect within the period of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 915 .
If an heir makes qualified acceptance , the rights and duties that person has towards the decedent shall be deemed not to have been extinguished .
A person who has made qualified acceptance shall continue administration of inherited property with the same care he/she would exercise over his/her own property .

Article 645 , Article 646 , paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- and paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 650 , paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- and paragraph -LRB- 3 -RRB- of Article 918 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in the preceding paragraph .

description: (Administration by Person who has Made Qualified Acceptance)

sentences.text: A person who makes qualified acceptance shall , within five days of making that qualified acceptance , make public notification to all inheritance obligees -LRB- here and below , an obligee with a claim towards the inherited property -RRB- and donees to the effect that qualified acceptance has been made and that filing of any claim should be made within a specified period .
In this case , that period shall be not less than two months .

In the public notification in the preceding paragraph , it shall be prescribed that inheritance obliges and donees who failed to file should be precluded from the payment ; provided , however , that a successor who makes qualified acceptance may not preclude known inheritance obliges and donees .
a successor who makes qualified acceptance shall demand each of known inheritance obliges and donees the filing .
reverb: each of known inheritance obliges and donees

sentences.text: The public notice in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- shall be made on the official gazette .

description: (Public Notification and Notice to Inheritance Obligees and Donees)

sentences.text: A person who has made qualified acceptance may refuse to make performance to an inheritance obligee or donee before the expiration of the notification period of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the preceding Article .

description: (Refusal of Performance before Expiration of Public Notification Period)

sentences.text: After the expiration of the period in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 927 , a person who has made qualified acceptance shall use the inherited property to make performance to inheritance obligees who have made the application of the same paragraph within the period prescribed , and any other known inheritance obligees , proportionally according to the amount of each claim ; provided that this may not prejudice the rights of an obligee with priority rights .
reverb: may not prejudice the rights of

sentences.text: -LRB- Performance of Obligation etc. .
Not Yet Due -RRB-

description: (Performance after Expiration of Public Notification Period)

sentences.text: A person who has made qualified acceptance must make performance even of a claim which is not yet due in accordance with the provision of the preceding Article .
Conditional claims and claims of indefinite duration shall be performed in accordance with an evaluation by an appraiser appointed by the family court .
reverb: Conditional claims and claims of indefinite duration

sentences.text: A person who has made qualified acceptance may not make performance to a donee unless each of the inheritance obligees has been paid in accordance with the provisions of the preceding two Articles .

If it is necessary to sell inherited property in order to perform in accordance with the provisions of the preceding three Articles , a person who has made qualified acceptance shall put that property to auction ; provided that this auction may be averted by paying the entire or partial value of the inherited property in accordance with an evaluation by an appraiser appointed by the family court .

description: (Auction of Inherited Property for Performance of Obligation)

sentences.text: Inheritance obligees and donees may , by their own expense , participate in an auction or appraisal of inherited property .
reverb: an auction or appraisal of inherited property

sentences.text: In this case , the provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 260 shall apply mutatis mutandis .
-LRB- Liability for Unfair Performance etc. of Person who has Made Qualified Acceptance -RRB-

description: (Participation of Inheritance Obligees and Donees in Evaluation Proceedings)

sentences.text: If a person who has made qualified acceptance fails to make the public notification or notice referred to in Article 927 , or has made performance to an inheritance obligee or donee within the period of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the same Article thereby precluding performance to any other inheritance obligee or donee , that person shall be liable to compensate for damages arising from this .
reverb: shall be liable to compensate for

sentences.text: If he/she has made performance that violates the provisions of Articles 929 to 931 inclusive , he/she shall be liable to compensate for damages arising from this .
reverb: shall be liable to compensate for

sentences.text: The provision of the preceding paragraph shall not prevent a claim for damages against an inheritance obligee or donee who has accepted unfair performance with knowledge by another inheritance obligee or donee .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: The provision of Article 724 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the cases referred to in the preceding two paragraphs .

An inheritance obligee or donee who fails to make the application referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 927 within the period prescribed , and was unknown to the person who has made qualified acceptance , may only exercise his/her rights over the residual assets ; provided that this shall not apply to persons who have a security over specific inherited property .
reverb: may only exercise his/her rights over

description: (Inheritance Obligees or Donees who have not Made Application within Period of Public Notification)

sentences.text: In the case where there are two or more heirs , the family court shall appoint an administrator of the inherited property from amongst the heirs .
The administrator of the inherited property of the preceding paragraph shall undertake all necessary acts to administer the inherited property and perform any obligation on behalf of the heirs .
reverb: The administrator of the inherited property of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: The provisions of Article 926 to 935 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to an administrator of the inherited property of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- .
reverb: an administrator of the inherited property of paragraph

sentences.text: In this case , ` within five days of making that qualified acceptance ' in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 927 shall be read as ` within ten days of the appointment of an administrator of the inherited property ' .
reverb: ` within ten days of the appointment of an administrator of the inherited property '

description: (Administration of Inherited Property where Two or more Heirs)

sentences.text: If there is a cause listed in item -LRB- i -RRB- or item -LRB- iii -RRB- of Article 921 relating to one or several joint heirs who have made qualified acceptance , an inheritance obligee may exercise his/her rights over the portion of his/her claim not satisfied by the inherited property against those joint heirs according to the share in inheritance of each .

description: (Inheritance Obligees Where There is Cause for Statutory Unconditional Acceptance)

sentences.text: A person who intends to renounce inheritance shall make a statement to that effect to the family court .
A person who has renounced inheritance shall be deemed as not originally having been an heir to the inheritance .

A person who has renounced inheritance shall continue the administration of inherited property with the same care he/she would exercise over his/her own property until the person who has become an heir by that renunciation has commenced administration of the inherited property .

Article 645 , Article 646 , paragraphs -LRB- 1 -RRB- and -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 650 , paragraphs -LRB- 2 -RRB- and paragraph -LRB- 3 -RRB- of Article 918 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in the preceding paragraph .

description: (Administration by Person who has Renounced Inheritance)

sentences.text: An inheritance obligee or a donee may make an application to the family court for a separation of inheritance property from the property of an heir within three months of the time of commencement of inheritance .
The application may be filed even after that period has elapsed if the inherited property has not been mixed with the heir 's own property .

If the family court has made a ruling for separation of property pursuant to the application of the preceding paragraph , the applicant shall give public notice within five days to the effect that an order for separation of property has been made and that applications for entry into distribution proceedings should be made within a specified period .
In this case , that period shall be not less than two months .
The public notice of the provisions of the preceding paragraph shall be listed in the official gazette .
reverb: The public notice of the provisions of the preceding paragraph

description: (Separation of Property by Claim of Inheritance Obligees or Donees)

sentences.text: A person who has made an application for separation of property or a person who has applied for entry into distribution proceedings pursuant to the provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of the preceding Article shall receive performance with priority over the obligees of an heir regarding the inherited property .
If an application for separation of property is made , the family court may order any necessary disposition for the administration of the inherited property .
The provisions of Articles 27 to 29 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where the family court appoints an administrator pursuant to the provision of the preceding paragraph .

description: (Administration of Inherited Property after Claim for Separation of Property)

sentences.text: Even after an heir has made unconditional acceptance , if there has been an application for separation of property , he/she shall administer the inherited property with the same care he/she would exercise over his/her own property ; provided that this shall not apply if the family court has appointed an administrator of the inherited property .
The provisions of Articles 645 to 647 inclusive and paragraphs -LRB- 1 -RRB- and -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 650 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in the preceding paragraph .

description: (Administration by Heir after Application for Separation of Property)

sentences.text: A separation of property regarding real estate may not be asserted against a third party unless the separation is registered .

description: (Requirement of Perfection, against Third Party regarding Real Estate in the Case of Separation of Property)

sentences.text: The provisions of Article 304 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case of separation of property .
reverb: the case of separation of property

description: (Application Mutatis Mutandis of Provisions regarding Extension of Security Interest to the Proceeds of Collateral)

sentences.text: Before the expiration of the period in paragraphs -LRB- 1 -RRB- and -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 941 , an heir may refuse to make performance to an inheritance obligee or donee .

If an application for separation of property has been made , an heir shall use the inherited property to make performance to any inheritance obligee or donee who has made an application for separation of property or entry into distribution proceedings proportionally according to the amount of each claim , after the expiration of the period of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 941 ; provided however , that this may not prejudice the rights of an obligee with priority rights .
reverb: may not prejudice the rights of

sentences.text: The provisions of Articles 930 to 934 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in the preceding paragraph .

A person who has made an application for separation of property or a person who has applied for entry into distribution proceedings may exercise his/her rights against an heir 's own property only in the case where he/she was not able to receive performance in full from the inherited property .
In this case , this person may receive performance with priority over the obligees of an heir .
-LRB- Prevention etc. of Application for Separation of Property -RRB-

An heir may use his/her own property to make performance to an inheritance obligee or donee , or provide reasonable security , and thereby prevent an application for separation of property or have its effect extinguished ; provided that this shall not apply if an obligee of the heir expresses an objection and can prove that he/she would receive damage from this .

While an heir may make qualified acceptance , or while the inherited property has not been mixed with the heir 's own property , an obligee of the heir may make an application to the family court for a separation of property .

The provisions of Article 304 , Article 925 , Articles 927 to 934 inclusive , Articles 943 to 945 inclusive , and Article 948 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in the preceding paragraph ; provided , however , that the public notification and notice of Article 927 shall be made by an obligee who has made an application for separation of property .
reverb: the public notification and notice of Article 927

description: (Separation of Property by Application of Obligee of Heir)

sentences.text: If it is not evident whether an heir exists , an estate that would be inherited shall be as a juridical person .

description: (Formation of Juridical Person for Inherited Property)

sentences.text: In the case referred to in the preceding Article , the family court shall appoint an administrator of inherited property at the request of an interested party or a public prosecutor .
If an administrator of inherited property has been appointed pursuant to the provisions of the preceding paragraph , the family court shall give public notice of this without delay .
reverb: the provisions of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: The provisions of Articles 27 to 29 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to the administrator of inherited property referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the preceding Article -LRB- in this Chapter , ` administrator of inherited property ' -RRB- .

description: (Provisions Relating to Administrator of Absentee's Property to be Applied Mutatis Mutandis)

sentences.text: If there is an application by an inheritance obligee or donee , an administrator of inherited property shall report the status of the inherited property to the person who has made the application .

If it has become evident that there is an heir , the juridical person of Article 951 shall be deemed not to have been formed ; provided , however , that this shall not prevent the effect of acts done by an administrator of inherited property within the administrator 's authority .
reverb: shall not prevent the effect of

description: (Non-formation of Juridical Person for Inherited Property)

sentences.text: The authority of representation of an administrator of inherited property shall be extinguished from the time that an heir accepts inheritance .
reverb: The authority of representation of an administrator of inherited property

sentences.text: In the case referred to in the preceding paragraph , the administrator of inherited property shall make an account of profit and loss to the heir without delay .

description: (Extinguishment of Authority of Representation of Administrator of Inherited Property)

sentences.text: If the existence of an heir has not become evident within two months of the public notice of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 952 , an administrator of inherited property shall , without delay , give public notice to all inheritance obligees and donees to the effect that a claim for performance should be made within a specified period .
reverb: two months of the public notice of paragraph

sentences.text: In this case , the period shall be not less than two months .

The provisions of paragraphs -LRB- 2 -RRB- to -LRB- 4 -RRB- inclusive of Article 927 and Articles 928 to 935 -LRB- excluding the proviso to Article 932 -RRB- shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case referred to in the preceding paragraph .

If , after the expiration of the period in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of the preceding Article , it is still not evident whether an heir exists , the family court shall , at the request of an administrator of inherited property or a public prosecutor , give public notice to the effect that if there is an heir , he/she should assert his/her right within a fixed period .
reverb: the request of an administrator of inherited property

sentences.text: In this case , the period shall be not less than six months .

If there is no person who asserts a right as an heir within the period of the preceding Article , an heir , or any obligee or donee unknown to the administrator of inherited property , may not exercise his/her right .

description: (Case where No Person Claims a Right)

sentences.text: In the case referred to in the preceding Article , the family court may , if it finds it reasonable , at the request of a person who shared a livelihood with the decedent , a person who contributed to the medical treatment and nursing of the decedent , or any other person who had a special connection with the decedent , grant such person the remaining amount of the inherited property after liquidation , in whole or in part .
reverb: the medical treatment and nursing of the decedent

sentences.text: The application of the preceding paragraph must be made within three months of the expiration of the period in Article 958 .
reverb: The application of the preceding paragraph
three months of the expiration of the period

description: (Distribution of Inherited Property to Person with Special Connection)

sentences.text: Inherited property that has not been disposed of pursuant to the provisions of the preceding Article shall belong to the National Treasury .
reverb: the provisions of the preceding Article

sentences.text: In this case , the provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 956 shall apply mutatis mutandis .

description: (Residual Assets to Belong to National Treasury)

sentences.text: No will shall take effect unless made in accordance with the formalities provided in this Code .
Any person who has attained 15 years of age may make a will .
The provisions of Article 5 , Article 9 , Article 13 and Article 17 shall not apply to a will .
At the time of making a will , a testator shall have the capacity to do so .

A testator may make a disposition of his/her property , in whole or in part , comprehensive or specific title -LRB- s -RRB- ; provided that this may not violate provisions regarding legally reserved portion .
The provisions of Article 886 and Article 891 shall apply mutatis mutandis to a testamentary donee .

description: (Provisions Relating to Heirs to be Applied Mutatis Mutandis)

sentences.text: If a person under guardianship makes a will to the benefit of a guardian or the guardian 's spouse or lineal relative before the completion of a profit and loss account for guardianship , that will shall be void .
The provision of the preceding paragraph shall not apply in the case where a lineal relative , spouse , or sibling of the ward is a guardian .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph

description: (Limitations on Will of Person under Guardianship)

sentences.text: A will shall be made by holograph document , notarized document , or sealed and notarized document ; provided that this shall not apply to the case where it is permissible to use a special method .

description: (Types of Will Made by Ordinary form)

sentences.text: To make a will by holograph document the testator must write the entire text , the date , and his/her name in his/her own hand and affix his/her seal .

Unless , for an insertion , deletion or any other alteration to the handwritten certificate , the testator indicates the place of alteration , makes a specifically signed addition to the effect that it has been changed , and furthermore affixes his/her seal to the place that has been altered , it shall have no effect .

A will by notarized document shall be made in compliance with the following items : -LRB- i -RRB- no fewer than two witnesses shall be in attendance ; -LRB- ii -RRB- the testator shall give oral instruction of the tenor of the will to a notary public ; -LRB- iii -RRB- a notary public shall take dictation from the testator and read this aloud , or allow inspection , to the testator and witnesses ; -LRB- iv -RRB- the testator and witnesses shall each sign , and affix his/her seal to , the certificate after having approved its accuracy ; provided , however , that in the case where a testator is unable to sign , a notary public may sign on his/her behalf , with supplementary registration giving the reason for that ; and -LRB- v -RRB- a notary public shall give supplementary registration to the effect that the certificate has been made in compliance with the formalities listed in each of the preceding items , sign this , and affix his/her seal .

In the case where a will by notarized document is made by a person who can not speak , the testator shall make a statement of the tenor of the will through an interpreter , or by his/her own hand , in lieu of the oral instruction of item -LRB- ii -RRB- of the preceding Article .

In this case , in the application of the provision of item -LRB- iii -RRB- of the same Article , ` oral instruction ' in that item shall become ` statement through an interpreter , or by his/her own hand ' .

In the case where the testator or a witness of the preceding Article is deaf , a notary public may convey the written contents of the provision of item -LRB- iii -RRB- of the same Article to the testator or witness through an interpreter , in lieu of the reading aloud provided for in the same item .
reverb: the written contents of the provision of item

sentences.text: If a notarized document has been made in compliance with the formalities provided for in the preceding paragraphs -LRB- 1 -RRB- and -LRB- 2 -RRB- , a notary public shall give supplementary registration on the certificate to this effect .

description: (Special Provisions for Will by Notarized Document)

sentences.text: A will by sealed and notarized document shall be made in compliance with the following formalities : -LRB- i -RRB- the testator shall sign , and affix his/her seal to , the certificate ; -LRB- ii -RRB- the testator shall seal the certificate and , using the same stamp as that used for the certificate , affix his/her seal ; -LRB- iii -RRB- the testator shall submit the sealed certificate before one notary public and not less than two witnesses , with a statement to the effect that it is his/her own will , giving the author 's name and address ; -LRB- iv -RRB- after having entered the date of submission of the certificate and the statement of the testator upon the sealed document , a notary public shall , together with the testator and witnesses , sign it and affix his/her seal ; and -LRB- 2 -RRB- The provision of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 968 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the making of a will by sealed and notarized document .

Even a will by sealed and notarized document which fails to satisfy the formalities provided for in the preceding Article shall have effect as a will made by holograph document , if prepared in accordance with the formalities provided for in Article 968 .

description: (Effect of Will by Sealed and Notarized Document Failing to Satisfy Formalities)

sentences.text: In the case where a will by sealed and notarized document is made by a person who can not speak , the testator shall make a statement to the effect that the certificate is one 's own will , giving the author 's name and address through an interpreter , or by his/her own hand upon the sealed document , in lieu of the statement of item -LRB- iii -RRB- of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- of Article 970 .
In the case referred to in the preceding paragraph , if a testator has given a statement through an interpreter , a notary public shall make an entry on the sealed document to that effect .

In the case referred to in paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- , if the testator has written on the sealed document is in his/her own hand , a notary public shall make an entry to that effect on the sealed document in lieu of the entry of statement in the provision of item -LRB- iv -RRB- of paragraph 1 of Article 970 .

description: (Special Provisions for Will by Sealed and Notarized Document)

sentences.text: For an adult ward to make a will at a time that his/her decision-making capacity has recovered temporarily , not less than two doctors shall be in attendance .

A doctor in attendance of the making of a will shall make an entry on the will to the effect that the testator was not in a condition lacking decision-making capacity at the time of making the will , sign it , and affix his/her seal ; provided that in the case of a will by sealed and notarized document , he/she shall make an entry to that effect on the sealed document , sign it , and affix his/her seal .
reverb: attendance of the making of a will

sentences.text: The following persons may not be a witness or observer to a will : -LRB- i -RRB- a minor ; -LRB- ii -RRB- a presumed heir , donee , or a spouse or lineal relative of either ; or -LRB- iii -RRB- a spouse , relative within four degrees , secretary , or employee of a notary public .

description: (Causes of Disqualification of Witness or Observer)

sentences.text: A will may not be made by two or more persons on the same certificate .
reverb: will may not be made by

sentences.text: If a person who is rapidly approaching death due to illness or another reason intends to make a will , he/she may do so in the attendance of not less than three witnesses by giving oral instruction of the tenor of the will to one of the witnesses .

In this case , the person who received the oral instruction shall enter this , read it aloud , or allow inspection , to the testator and other witnesses , and after each witness has approved the accuracy of that entry , sign it , and affix his/her seal .

In the case where a person who can not speak makes a will pursuant to the provisions of the preceding paragraph , the testator shall state of the tenor of that will through an interpreter before the witnesses , in lieu of the oral instruction of the same paragraph .
reverb: the provisions of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: In the case where the testator , or a witness , referred to in the second sentence of paragraph -LRB- 1 -RRB- is deaf , the person who has received the statement or oral instruction of the tenor of the will shall convey to the testator or other witnesses the written contents referred to in the provision of that sentence through an interpreter in lieu of the reading aloud provided for in that sentence .
reverb: the statement or oral instruction of the tenor of the will
the statement or oral instruction of the tenor of the will

sentences.text: For a will made pursuant to the provisions of the preceding three paragraphs , effect shall not arise unless it has been confirmed by the family court at the request of one of the witnesses or an interested party within twenty days of the creation of the will .
The family court may not confirm a will referred to in the preceding paragraph unless it is convinced that the will captured the true intention of the testator .

description: (Will Made by Person Rapidly Approaching Death)

sentences.text: A person who is isolated through an administrative disposition due to an infectious disease may make a will in the attendance of one police official and at least one witness .
reverb: the attendance of one police official

description: (Will Made by Person with Infectious Disease in Quarantine)

sentences.text: A person on a ship may make a will in the attendance of the ship 's captain or a clerk , and at least two witnesses .
reverb: the attendance of the ship 's captain

sentences.text: In the case where a ship meets disaster , a person who is on that ship and rapidly approaching death may make a will orally in the attendance of at least two witnesses .
reverb: may make a will orally in
the attendance of at least two witnesses

sentences.text: In the case where a person who can not speak makes a will pursuant to the provision of the preceding paragraph , the testator shall do so through an interpreter .
reverb: the provision of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: The effect of a will made in compliance with the provisions of the preceding two paragraphs shall not arise unless a witness makes an entry of its tenor , signs this , affixes his/her seal , and furthermore , it gains confirmation by the family court at the request made without delay by one of the witnesses or an interested party .
reverb: the provisions of the preceding two paragraphs

sentences.text: The provision of paragraph -LRB- 5 -RRB- of Article 976 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case described in the preceding paragraph .

description: (Will Made by Person on Ship Meeting Disaster)

sentences.text: In the cases described in Article 977 and Article 978 , a testator , author , observer , or witness shall sign and affix his/her seal to each will .

description: (Signature and Seal of Relevant Parties to a Will)

sentences.text: In the cases described in Articles 977 to 979 inclusive , if there is a person who is unable to sign or affix his/her seal , an observer or witness shall make supplementary registration of the reason for that .

description: (Case Where Signature or Seal Is Impossible)

sentences.text: The provisions of paragraph -LRB- 2 -RRB- of Article 968 and Articles 973 to 975 inclusive shall apply mutatis mutandis to a will made pursuant to the provisions of Articles 976 to 981 .

description: (Provisions Relating to Will by Ordinary Formalities to be Applied Mutatis Mutandis)

sentences.text: The effect of a will made pursuant to the provisions of Article 976 to 982 inclusive shall not arise if a testator survives for a period of six months from the time they recover the ability to make a will by ordinary formalities .

description: (Effect of Will Made by Special Formalities)

sentences.text: For a Japanese national in a foreign country where a Japanese consulate is stationed to make a will by notarized document , or a sealed and notarized document , the duties of a notary public shall be undertaken by the consulate .
reverb: the duties of a notary public

description: (Formalities for Japanese National in Foreign Country)

sentences.text: A will takes effect at the time of the testator 's death .
reverb: the time of the testator 's death

sentences.text: In the case where a will is subject to a condition precedent , if that condition is fulfilled after the death of the testator , the will shall take effect from the time that condition is fulfilled .
A testamentary donee may renounce a testamentary gift at any time after the death of a testator .
The renunciation of a testamentary gift shall have retroactive effect from the time of the testator 's death .
reverb: The renunciation of a testamentary gift
the time of the testator 's death

sentences.text: A person with a duty of testamentary gift -LRB- in this Section , a person who bears a duty to perform a testamentary gift -RRB- or any other interested party may give notice to a testamentary donee to the effect that acceptance or renunciation of a testamentary gift should be made within a specified period , fixing a period that is reasonable .
reverb: acceptance or renunciation of a testamentary gift

sentences.text: In this case , if a donee does not indicate his/her intention to a person with a duty of testamentary gift within that period , the testamentary gift shall be deemed to have been accepted .

description: (Notice to Testamentary Donees for Acceptance or Renunciation of a Testamentary Gift)

sentences.text: If a testamentary donee dies without having made acceptance or renunciation of a testamentary gift , the heir of that person may accept or renounce the testamentary gift within the extent of his/her share in inheritance ; provided that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , this intent shall be complied with .

description: (Acceptance or Renunciation of Testamentary Gift by Heir or Testamentary Donee)

sentences.text: Acceptance or renunciation of a testamentary gift may not be revoked .
The provisions of paragraphs -LRB- 2 -RRB- and -LRB- 3 -RRB- of Article 919 shall apply mutatis mutandis to acceptance and renunciation of a testamentary gift .
reverb: acceptance and renunciation of a testamentary gift

description: (Revocation and Rescission of Acceptance and Renunciation of Testamentary Gift)

sentences.text: A testamentary donee by a universal succession shall have the same rights as an heir .
reverb: shall have the same rights as

description: (Rights and Duties of Testamentary Donee by a Universal Succession)

sentences.text: While a testamentary gift is not due , a testamentary donee may make a claim for reasonable security from a person having an obligation with respect to testamentary gift .
The same shall also apply for a testamentary gift with a condition precedent while the outcome of that condition is unknown .

description: (Claim for Security by a Testamentary Donee)

sentences.text: A testamentary donee may collect the fruits of a testamentary gift from the time that they are able to make a claim for the performance of that gift ; provided that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , that intent shall be complied with .
reverb: the fruits of a testamentary gift
are able to make a claim for

sentences.text: The provisions of Article 299 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where expenses have been incurred by a person with a duty of testamentary gift in respect of the object of the testamentary gift after the death of the testator .
An application for reimbursement may be made for normal necessary expenses incurred in collecting the fruits of a testamentary gift , limited to an amount not exceeding the value of those fruits .

description: (Claim for Reimbursement of Expenses Incurred by Person with Duty of Testamentary Gift)

sentences.text: The effect of a testamentary gift shall not arise if the testamentary donee dies before the death of the testator .

The preceding paragraph shall also apply if , in the case of a testamentary gift with a condition precedent , the testamentary donee dies before the fulfillment of that condition ; provided , however , that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , that intent shall be complied with .

description: (Lapse of Testamentary Gift through Death of Donee)

sentences.text: If the effect of a testamentary gift does not arise , or if its effect is lost by renunciation , that which should have been received by the testamentary donee shall belong to the heir -LRB- s -RRB- ; provided , however , that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , that intent shall be complied with .

description: (Ownership of Property in Case of Invalidation or Lapse of Testamentary Gift)

sentences.text: A testamentary gift shall not take effect if the rights which are the object of that gift did not belong to the inherited property at the time of the testator 's death ; provided , however , that this shall not apply if it is found that those rights were made the object of a testamentary gift regardless of whether such rights belong to the inherited property .

description: (Testamentary Gift of Rights Not Belonging to Inherited Property)

sentences.text: If a testamentary gift , the object of which are rights that do not belong to the inherited property , has effect pursuant to the provision of the proviso to the preceding Article , the person with a duty of testamentary gift shall bear a duty to obtain those rights and transfer them to the testamentary donee .

In the case referred to in the preceding paragraph , if the rights referred to in that paragraph can not be obtained , or if obtaining them requires excessive expenses , a person with a duty of testamentary gift shall give compensation to the value of those rights ; provided , however , that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , that intent shall be complied with .

In the case where a testamentary gift has as its object unspecified Things but a third party as a rightful claimant retakes them from a testamentary donee , a person having an obligation in relation to testamentary gift shall be liable under the same warranty with respect to those unspecified Things , just as a seller .

In the case where a testamentary gift has as its object unspecified Things , if those goods are defective , a person having an obligation in relation to testamentary gift shall exchange them for Things that are not defective .

description: (Warranty Liability of Person Having Obligation for to Testamentary Gift for Unspecified Things)

sentences.text: If a testator has a right to claim compensation from a third party resulting from loss or alteration , or loss of possession , of the object of a testamentary gift , that right shall be presumed to have been an object of the testamentary gift .

In the case of accession or mixture of the object of a testamentary gift with other Things , if a testator has become a sole owner or co-owner of a compound or mixture pursuant to the provisions of Articles 243 to 245 inclusive , that entire ownership , or share , shall be presumed to have been an object of the testamentary gift .
reverb: a sole owner or co-owner of a compound or mixture pursuant

description: (Extension of Testamentary Gift over Right to Claim from Third Party)

sentences.text: If Things or rights being the object of a testamentary gift were the object of the rights of a third party at the time of the testator 's death , a testamentary donee may not demand a person having an obligation with respect to testamentary gift to extinguish the third party 's rights ; provided , however , that this shall not apply if the testator has indicated a contrary intent in his/her will .
reverb: the object of a testamentary gift
the rights of a third party

description: (Testamentary Gift of Property Subject to the Rights of Third party)

sentences.text: In the case where a claim is the object of a testamentary gift , if the testator has received performance for that claim and the received Things are already with the inherited property , those Things shall be presumed to have been an object of the testamentary gift .

In the case where money is the object of a claim which is the object of a testamentary gift , that money shall be presumed to have been an object of the testamentary gift even if there are insufficient funds equivalent to that claim in the inherited property .

description: (Extension of Testamentary Gift over Things Received for Satisfaction of Claim)

sentences.text: A person who has received a testamentary gift with burden shall bear a responsibility to perform the duties borne , limited to an amount not exceeding the object of the testamentary gift .
reverb: has received a testamentary gift with

sentences.text: If a testamentary donee has renounced a testamentary gift with burden , the person who would have received gain from the discharge of burden may become a testamentary donee him/herself ; provided that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , that intent shall be complied with .

If the value of an object of a testamentary gift with burden is reduced due to the qualified acceptance of an heir , or a filing for recovery of legally reserved portion , a testamentary donee may avoid the duties borne from that testamentary gift , proportional to the reduction ; provided , however , that if the testator has indicated a particular intent in his/her will , that intent shall be complied with .
reverb: the qualified acceptance of an heir

description: (Discharge of Testamentary Donee of Testamentary Gift with Burden)

sentences.text: A custodian of a will , after coming to know of the commencement of inheritance , shall without delay submit the will to the family court and apply for probate .
In the case where there is no custodian of a will , the same shall apply after an heir discovers the will .
The provision of the preceding paragraph shall not apply to a will made by notarized document .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: A will that has been sealed may not be opened unless in the family court in the attendance of an heir or his/her representative .

A person who fails to submit a will pursuant to the provisions of the preceding Article , executes a will without passing through probate , or opens a sealed will in a place other than a family court shall be made subject to a civil fine of not more than 50,000 yen .
reverb: a civil fine of not more than 50,000 yen

sentences.text: A testator may , by will , designate one or several executors , or entrust that designation to a third party .
A person who has been entrusted with the designation of an executor shall , without delay , make that designation and inform the heir -LRB- s -RRB- of the designation .
If a person who has been entrusted with the designation of an executor intends to resign from that entrustment , he/she shall notify the heir -LRB- s -RRB- to that effect without delay .
If an executor consents to taking office , he/she shall undertake his/her duties immediately .

An heir or other interested party may , having specified a reasonable period , make a demand to an executor to the effect that that he/she make a definite answer within that period as to whether he/she consents to taking office .
reverb: An heir or other interested party

sentences.text: In this case , if the executor does not make a definite answer to the heir within this period , he/she shall be deemed to have consented to taking office .
reverb: does not make a definite answer to

sentences.text: A minor or a bankrupt may not become an executor .
If an executor does not exist , or the office becomes vacant , the family court may appoint an executor at the request of an interested party .
An executor shall , without delay , prepare an inventory of inherited property and deliver this to the heir -LRB- s -RRB- .
At the request of an heir , an executor shall prepare an inventory of inherited property in the heir 's attendance , or have a notary public create the inventory .
An executor shall have the rights and duties of administration of inherited property and all other necessary acts for the execution of a will .
reverb: the rights and duties of administration of inherited property

sentences.text: The provisions of Articles 644 to 647 inclusive and 650 shall apply mutatis mutandis to an executor .
In the case where there is an executor , an heir may not make a disposition of inherited property or any other act that interferes with the execution of the will .

description: (Prohibition of Interference with Execution of Will)

sentences.text: In the case where a will concerns specified property in the inherited property , the provisions of Articles 1011 to 1013 inclusive shall only apply to that specified property .
An executor shall be deemed the representative of the heir -LRB- s -RRB- .

An executor may not allow a third party to undertake the duties of an executor unless there are justifiable reasons ; provided , however , that this shall not apply if the testator has indicated a contrary intent in his/her will .

In the case where an executor has allowed a third party to undertake the duties of an executor pursuant to the provision in the proviso to the preceding paragraph , the executor shall owe the responsibility referred to in Article 105 to the heir -LRB- s -RRB- .

In the case where there are two or more executors , execution of their duties shall be decided by majority ; provided , however , that this shall not apply if the testator has indicated a contrary intent in his/her will .
Despite the provision of the preceding paragraph , each executor may undertake an act of preservation .

description: (Execution of Duties Where Two or More Executors)

sentences.text: The family court may determine the remuneration of an executor according to the status of the inherited property and other circumstances ; provided that this shall not apply in the case where a testator has specified remuneration in his/her will .
The provisions of paragraphs -LRB- 2 -RRB- and -LRB- 3 -RRB- of Article 648 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where an executor receives remuneration .
If an executor has failed to perform his/her duties , or if there is any other justifiable reason , an interested party may apply to the family court for the dismissal of that executor .
An executor may resign from his or her duties with the permission of the family court if there is a justifiable reason .
The provisions of Article 654 and Article 655 shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case of termination of duties of an executor .
reverb: the case of termination of duties of an executor

description: (Mandate Provisions to be Applied Mutatis Mutandis)

sentences.text: Expenses relating to the execution of a will shall be borne by the inherited property ; provided , however , that legally reserved portion may not be reduced by this .

description: (Burden of Expenses Relating to Execution of Will)

sentences.text: A testator may at any time revoke a will in whole or in part in compliance with the formalities for a will .
If there is a conflict between a previous and later will , the later will shall be deemed as having revoked the previous will with respect to the part that is in conflict .
The provision of the preceding paragraph shall apply mutatis mutandis to the case where a will conflicts with a disposition or other juristic act made while the testator was still alive .
reverb: The provision of the preceding paragraph

sentences.text: If a testator intentionally destroys a will , this shall be deemed a revocation of the will with respect to the part that has been destroyed .
The same shall apply if the testator has intentionally destroyed goods the object of a testamentary gift .

description: (Destruction of Will or Things made the Object of Testamentary Gift)

sentences.text: The effect of a will that has been revoked pursuant to the provisions of Articles 1022 to 1024 inclusive shall not be recovered even if the act of revocation is revoked , rescinded , or invalidated ; provided , however , that this shall not apply in the case where the act was the result of fraud or duress .

description: (Effect of Will That Has Been Revoked)

sentences.text: A testator may not waive the right to revoke a will .

description: (Prohibition of Waiver of Right to Revocation)

sentences.text: If a person who has received a testamentary gift with burden does not perform the duty imposed thereby , an heir may demand performance of that duty fixing a reasonable period to do so .
reverb: has received a testamentary gift with

sentences.text: In this case , if there is no performance within that period , an application may be made to the family court for rescission of the will concerning the testamentary gift with burden .

description: (Rescission of Will concerning Testamentary Gift with Burden)

sentences.text: Heirs other than siblings shall receive , as legally reserved portion , an amount equivalent to the ratio prescribed in each of the following items in accordance with the divisions listed therein : -LRB- i -RRB- in the case where only lineal ascendants are heirs , one third of the decedent 's property ; -LRB- ii -RRB- in cases other than that referred to in the preceding item -LRB- i -RRB- , one half of the decedent 's property .

description: (Entitlement and Amount of Legally Reserved Portion)

sentences.text: Total legally reserved portion shall be calculated as the value of any gifts made by the decedent added to the value of the property held by the decedent at the time of commencement of inheritance minus the entire amount of obligations .
The determination of the value of conditional rights or rights of an uncertain duration shall be made in accordance with an evaluation by an appraiser appointed by the family court .
reverb: The determination of the value of conditional rights or rights of an uncertain duration

sentences.text: Only a gift made within one year before the commencement of inheritance shall be included in the amount calculated pursuant to the provisions of the preceding Article .

A gift made before one year prior to commencement shall be included in the amount calculated pursuant to the provisions of the preceding Article if it was made with the knowledge of both parties that it would cause harm to a claimant for legally reserved portion .

A claimant for legally reserved portion , or his/her heir , may claim for abatement of a testamentary gift , or gift referred to in the preceding Article , to the extent necessary to preserve that legally reserved portion .
